name.en: Chemical and Materials Engineering Thermodynamics Ⅱ

department.ch: 化學工程與材料工程學系

goal.en: “Topics covered include but not limited to: (a) Smith, J. M.; Van Ness, H. C.; Abbott, M. M.; Swihart, M. T. Introduction To Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics; 8th ed.; Mcgraw Hill Education: New York, 2018. Chapter10: The Framework of Solution Thermodynamics Chapter11: Mixing Processes Chapter12: Phase Equilibrium: Introduction Chapter13: Thermodynamic Formulations for Vapor/Liquid Equilibrium (b) Gaskell, D.; Laughlin, D. Introduction to The Thermodynamics of Materials; 6th ed.; CRC Press: New York, 2018. Chapter9: The Behavior of Solutions Chapter10: Gibbs Free Energy Composition and Phase Diagrams of Binary Systems“
goal.ch: “Topics covered include but not limited to: (a) Smith, J. M.; Van Ness, H. C.; Abbott, M. M.; Swihart, M. T. Introduction To Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics; 8th ed.; Mcgraw Hill Education: New York, 2018. Chapter10: The Framework of Solution Thermodynamics Chapter11: Mixing Processes Chapter12: Phase Equilibrium: Introduction Chapter13: Thermodynamic Formulations for Vapor/Liquid Equilibrium (b) Gaskell, D.; Laughlin, D. Introduction to The Thermodynamics of Materials; 6th ed.; CRC Press: New York, 2018. Chapter9: The Behavior of Solutions Chapter10: Gibbs Free Energy Composition and Phase Diagrams of Binary Systems“

content.en:
(a)
Ch10: The Framework of Solution Thermodynamics (week 1 (2/21) to week 4 (3/13))
Ch11: Mixing Processes (week 5 (3/20) and week 6(3/27))
Ch12: Phase Equilibrium: Introduction (week 7 (4/3) and week 8 (4/10))
Mid-Term Exam (week 9 (4/17))
Ch13: Thermodynamic Formulations for Vapor/Liquid Equilibrium (week 10 (4/24) and week 11 (5/1))
(b)
Ch9: The Behavior of Solutions (week 12 (5/8))
Ch10: Gibbs Free Energy Composition and Phase Diagrams of Binary Systems (week 13 (5/15) to week 17(6/12))
Final Exam (week 18 (6/19))
content.ch:
(a)
Ch10: The Framework of Solution Thermodynamics (week 1 (2/21) to week 4 (3/13))
Ch11: Mixing Processes (week 5 (3/20) and week 6(3/27))
Ch12: Phase Equilibrium: Introduction (week 7 (4/3) and week 8 (4/10))
Mid-Term Exam (week 9 (4/17))
Ch13: Thermodynamic Formulations for Vapor/Liquid Equilibrium (week 10 (4/24) and week 11 (5/1))
(b)
Ch9: The Behavior of Solutions (week 12 (5/8))
Ch10: Gibbs Free Energy Composition and Phase Diagrams of Binary Systems (week 13 (5/15) to week 17(6/12))
Final Exam (week 18 (6/19))

textbook.en: (a) Smith, J. M.; Van Ness, H. C.; Abbott, M. M.; Swihart, M. T. Introduction To Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics; 8th ed.; Mcgraw Hill Education: New York, 2018. (b) Stanley I. Sandler. Principles of Chemical, Biochemical and Engineering Thermodynamics; 5th ed. (c) Gaskell, D.; Laughlin, D. Introduction to The Thermodynamics of Materials; 6th ed.; CRC Press: New York, 2018.
textbook.ch: “(a) Smith, J. M.; Van Ness, H. C.; Abbott, M. M.; Swihart, M. T. Introduction To Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics; 8th ed.; Mcgraw Hill Education: New York, 2018. (b) Stanley I. Sandler. Principles of Chemical, Biochemical and Engineering Thermodynamics; 5th ed. (c) Gaskell, D.; Laughlin, D. Introduction to The Thermodynamics of Materials; 6th ed.; CRC Press: New York, 2018.“

grading.en: “The final grade is based on the followings: Attendance (15％), Homework (25％), Midterm Exam (30％) and Final Exam-Paper Reading (30％).“
